intro: Hieracium orthodes, commonly known as the common hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, with upright stems covered in fine hairs. Its basal leaves are lance-shaped and often have a rough texture, while the flowering stems bear smaller, alternate leaves. The flowers are yellow and arranged in a dense cluster, producing seeds that are dispersed by wind.
